name: sfchronicle
text: Amid mass protests, public health officials are raising alarms over a looming surge in coronavirus cases. https://t.co/z9Lx4Ezr6G

name: sfchronicle
text:
Prisoners went weeks without coronavirus testing before transfers to San Quentin, Corcoran.

Story by @MeganRCassidy & @JFagone: https://t.co/NLbYUyK68D

name: sfchronicle
text:
Yosemite National Park will reopen on Thursday, but with constraints:

- Number of people admitted will be restricted
- Visitors required to have advance reservations
- Some facilities will stay closed or have limited access

https://t.co/CdlUOFgXxZ

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: PG&E plans to sell its SF headquarters and move to Oakland, a cost-saving effort that will have the utility leave the city where it was born more than a century ago.

Story by @TheJDMorris & @RolandLiSF: https://t.co/se3xJspaDo

name: sfchronicle
text:
Alameda County sanctions "social bubbles" — a group of 12 or fewer who may socialize outside. Officials still recommend masks, physical distance. 

https://t.co/728r2QH8LK

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bob Myers unsure if Warriors’ @KlayThompson is fully recovered from knee injury.

Story by @Con_Chron: https://t.co/V8NDXhba1c

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here’s where California’s biggest police group spends its political money.

Story by @JFWildermuth: https://t.co/ptUYMgXFj7

name: sfchronicle
text:
Gov. Gavin Newsom’s medical mask deal with a Chinese manufacturer will proceed after the company succeeded in obtaining federal safety certification, following two missed deadlines.

Story by @DustinGardiner: https://t.co/ev7qXo1kMS

name: sfchronicle
text:
Not everyone in SF is woke: "Black Lives Matter" message on Bernal Heights’ rock keeps getting covered up.

@HKnightSF has the story here: https://t.co/kdns2Ut1gW

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland mayor releases statement on shooting death of Erik Salgado: Libby Schaaf said the CHP, the Alameda County district attorney and the Oakland Police Department are investigating the shooting by the CHP, which occurred Saturday night. https://t.co/rNi8krk5Rf https://t.co/OE5NQbviMN

name: sfchronicle
text: "The King of Staten Island" shows director @JuddApatow at his best, @MickLaSalle writes in his review: https://t.co/2lYoRtahbq

name: sfchronicle
text:
Movie theaters in California counties that have met the state's criteria for managing coronavirus can reopen Friday, June 12.

https://t.co/KH6d7CghgT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Movie theaters can reopen Friday in many California counties, with major changes.

Story by @akoseff: https://t.co/xmWNpH4LFm

name: sfchronicle
text: Members of the SF Public Defender’s Office wore Black Lives Matter shirts, held signs with the names of victims of police violence and kneeled together on Monday. “We stood for those killed by police,” public defender Mano Raju tweeted. https://t.co/RRT45id5y9 https://t.co/OrA6XABmGT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Patricia (Bonnie) Pointer, a soaring vocalist who learned to sing at her father’s Oakland church and rose to fame as a founding member of the Pointer Sisters in the early 1970s, died Monday.

Story by @SamWhitingSF: https://t.co/1e4ZNSZIx9

name: sfchronicle
text: Just in: Oakland Deputy Police Chief Leronne Armstrong said during a police commission meeting that the department is investigating the deployment of tear gas and other munitions last week during protests. https://t.co/YM8uaUG0O6 https://t.co/jY2TZL4G1V

name: sfchronicle
text: San Francisco buildings lit up to honor George Floyd: San Francisco’s City Hall, Coit Tower, International Airport and SF Conservatory were lit up red and gold on Monday night, according to Mayor London Breed. https://t.co/RDvJsDVX0w https://t.co/BBmbsIGGZr

name: sfchronicle
text: Coronavirus Updates: Residents of Alameda County are now required to wear a face covering at all times in public when anyone other than members of their “Social Bubble” is within 30 feet, unless exceptions apply, according to a new health order. https://t.co/7AvVhJMUYw

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland police commission demands police department make immediate changes: Edwin Prather, attorney and Oakland police commissioner, said police officers mishandled protests in Oakland last weekend and that the department must make immediate changes. https://t.co/9wwA2OsUyC

name: sfchronicle
text: Berkeley police “substantially” updated its “Use of Force” policy that has been in place for the last decade and gave a draft to the Police Review Commission earlier this year for consideration, police chief Andrew Greenwood wrote in a community message. https://t.co/G4bSggY4BQ https://t.co/aTeyPC9qyG

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/TeUn8tA2xo

name: sfchronicle
text:
Protests and coronavirus: There's growing concern that people at mass demonstrations could spread the virus among each other.

Here's how to get tested if you went to a protest: https://t.co/J6Q8vzvfEL

name: sfchronicle
text: Instead of wasting 30 hours binge-watching a TV series, spend the same time watching 15 movies by the same actor, or the same director. @MickLaSalle explains why this is a better use of your shelter in place time. https://t.co/XREhSJYmqX https://t.co/pTOw4XMyds

name: sfchronicle
text: Rents are down 9% from a year ago in San Francisco and over 15% in some tech hubs in the South Bay, according to a recent report by a rental housing search engine. https://t.co/NBeqIiBW7l

name: sfchronicle
text:
“The shelter in place was kind of a bold experiment that appears to have been dramatically successful,” said Dr. Robert Siegel, an infectious disease expert at Stanford.

https://t.co/QZO6uZfngd

name: sfchronicle
text: “Opening up is another experiment and we don’t know the result. But it certainly poses a risk that reversing the st… https://t.co/SzI15MATqx

name: sfchronicle
text:
Total coronavirus cases:
• 134,088 in California, including 4,663 deaths
• 15,886 in the Bay Area, including 470 deaths.
• More than 1.9M in the U.S., including 111,007 deaths.
• More than 7.1M in the world, with more than 403,000 deaths.   https://t.co/AVs1YSReqR https://t.co/sHK4FpVSV4

name: sfchronicle
text: A 49-year-old man was nearly shot to death Monday in S.F.'s Hunters Point neighborhood, authorities said. A report of a shooting came in around 11:30 p.m. in the area of Kirkwood and Earl streets. The victim suffered life-threatening injuries. https://t.co/4xOSZxOc6t https://t.co/83iCTFzEdo
